verses.verse: (God the Righteous Judge) A Psalm of Asaph. [1] The (Is. 9:6) Mighty One, God the LORD, Has spoken and called the earth From the rising of the sun to its going down.
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, (Deut. 33:2; Ps. 80:1) God will shine forth.
Our God shall come, and shall not keep silent; (Lev. 10:2; Num. 16:35; (Ps. 97:3)) A fire shall devour before Him, And it shall be very tempestuous all around Him.
(Deut. 4:26; 31:28; 32:1; Is. 1:2) He shall call to the heavens from above, And to the earth, that He may judge His people:
“Gather (Deut. 33:3) My saints together to Me, (Ex. 24:7) Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
Let the ((Ps. 97:6)) heavens declare His righteousness, For (Ps. 75:7) God Himself is Judge. Selah
“Hear, O My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you; (Ex. 20:2) I am God, your God!
(Jer. 7:22) I will not rebuke you (Is. 1:11; (Hos. 6:6)) for your sacrifices Or your burnt offerings, Which are continually before Me.
(Ps. 69:31) I will not take a bull from your house, Nor goats out of your folds.
For every beast of the forest is Mine, And the cattle on a thousand hills.
I know all the birds of the mountains, And the wild beasts of the field are Mine.
“If I were hungry, I would not tell you; (Ex. 19:5; (Deut. 10:14; Job 41:11); 1 Cor. 10:26) For the world is Mine, and all its fullness.
((Ps. 51:15-17)) Will I eat the flesh of bulls, Or drink the blood of goats?
(Hos. 14:2; Heb. 13:15) Offer to God thanksgiving, And (Num. 30:2; Deut. 23:21) pay your vows to the Most High.
(Job 22:27; (Zech. 13:9)) Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me.”
But to the wicked God says: “What right have you to declare My statutes, Or take My covenant in your mouth,
(Neh. 9:26; Rom. 2:21) Seeing you hate instruction And cast My words behind you?
When you saw a thief, you ((Rom. 1:32)) consented with him, And have been a (1 Tim. 5:22) partaker with adulterers.
You give your mouth to evil, And (Ps. 52:2) your tongue frames deceit.
You sit and speak against your brother; You slander your own mother’s son.
These things you have done, and I kept silent; ((Rom. 2:4)) You thought that I was altogether like you; But I will rebuke you, And ((Ps. 90:8)) set them in order before your eyes.
“Now consider this, you who ((Job 8:13)) forget God, Lest I tear you in pieces, And there be none to deliver:
Whoever offers praise glorifies Me; And (Gal. 6:16) to him who orders his conduct aright I will show the salvation of God.”
